acknowledgments.summary: Noam Moshe of Claroty Research reported these vulnerabilities to Honeywell.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the application permissions or escalate privileges.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text:
More information can be found in the Honeywell Security Notification SN2022-08-31 01 SoftMaster-R4.7
CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. CISA also recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-22-256-02 - Web Scraped Version

notes.text: If an attacker manages to trick a valid user into loading a malicious DLL, the attacker may be able to achieve code execution in the application’s context and permissions. CVE-2022-2333 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details:
Honeywell has released firmware update packages for the affected products on their website.
Honeywell recommends users with potentially affected products take the following steps to protect themselves:

cwe.name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource

notes.text: A local unprivileged attacker may escalate to administrator privileges, due to insecure permission assignment. CVE-2022-2332 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.2 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details:
Honeywell has released firmware update packages for the affected products on their website.
Honeywell recommends users with potentially affected products take the following steps to protect themselves:
